intro: Aubrieta kotschyi var. brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited aubrieta, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant produces compact clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant touch to rocky or alpine gardens. Its leaves are basal, simple, and hairy, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and hardiness in temperate climates.
